title: How to use my DVD player without a remote - Quora

response.answer_text: For most Blu-ray players, there are basic function buttons on the front or on the top of the panel, including “Power on/off”, “Eject”, “Play/Pause”, “Skip” and “Stop” buttons. If you are the owner of Android smartphones, then you can make full use of the function of the infrared blaster (IR blaster) in it which could emulate an infrared remote control to autonomously control your Blu-ray players, TVs, streaming boxes, home theater systems and so on. There are a lot of universal remote that can work with not only TVs but also Blu-ray and DVD players. Most universal remotes can work for most Blu-ray and DVD players. Source: How to play Blu-ray with out remote
Most DVD players (at least the newer ones) have enough buttons on their player to function without a remote. It might be a hassle to get up from your seat, but it still is doable.
